thread.title: Foreign Secretary: UK seeking ‘legally binding’ EU renegotiation
thread.title_full: Foreign Secretary: UK seeking ‘legally binding’ EU renegotiation - BBC News

author: BBC
title: Foreign Secretary: UK seeking ‘legally binding’ EU renegotiation
text:
Media playback is unsupported on your device Foreign Secretary: UK seeking ‘legally binding’ EU renegotiation 20 October 2015 Last updated at 11:32 BST
Foreign Secretary Philip Hammond has said the government is seeking legally binding agreement with the EU in the ongoing renegotiation.
Speaking on the Today programme , he said they were looking for “bankable” promises from members on matters including regulation, national sovereignty and welfare that would be incorporated into EU treaties at “the next available opportunity”.
He told John Humphrys that the negotiations were going well and that they were determined to secure “substantial, binding, irreversible” change in the UK’s relationship with the EU.
